poem:
Amidst the Crowd

In Istanbul's distant breaths,  
a sea of silent cries—  
two-point-two million shadows  
cascading through the streets.  
Ekrem's dream woven  
in protest's fabric,  
a ripple against  
the iron locks of power.  
The city listens,  
heartbeat by heartbeat,  
though distant,  
echoing louder  
than walls or chains.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative.
